intro: Cacalia interjecta, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. It has slender stems and narrow leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Cacalia interjecta is a herbaceous perennial that is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
